014package org.jdbi.v3.core.argument;
015
016import java.lang.reflect.Type;
017import java.util.Collection;
018import java.util.Collections;
019import java.util.Optional;
020import java.util.function.Function;
021
022import org.jdbi.v3.core.config.ConfigRegistry;
023import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
024import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Beta;
025
026/**
027 * Inspect a value with optional static type information and produce
028 * an {@link Argument} that binds the value to a prepared statement.
029 *
030 * Make sure to override {@link Object#toString} in your {@link Argument} instances if you want to be able to log their values with an {@link org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.SqlLogger}.
031 */
032@FunctionalInterface
033public interface ArgumentFactory {
034    /**
035     * Returns an {@link Argument} for the given value if the factory supports it; empty otherwise.
036     *
037     * @param type  the known type of value. Depending on the situation this may be a full generic signature e.g.
038     *              {@link java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType}, a {@link Class}, or Object.class if no type information
039     *              is known.
040     * @param value the value to convert into an {@link Argument}
041     * @param config the config registry, for composition
042     * @return an argument for the given value if this factory supports it, or <code>Optional.empty()</code> otherwise.
043     * @see StatementContext#findArgumentFor(Type, Object)
044     * @see Arguments#findFor(Type, Object)
045     */
046    Optional<Argument> build(Type type, Object value, ConfigRegistry config);
047
048    /**
049     * ArgumentFactory extension interface that allows preparing arguments for efficient batch binding.
050     */
051    @Beta
052    interface Preparable extends ArgumentFactory {
053        @Override
054        default Optional<Argument> build(Type type, Object value, ConfigRegistry config) {
055            return prepare(type, config).map(p -> p.apply(value));
056        }
057
058        Optional<Function<Object, Argument>> prepare(Type type, ConfigRegistry config);
059
060        /**
061         * @deprecated no longer used
062         */
063        @Deprecated
064        default Collection<? extends Type> prePreparedTypes() {
065            return Collections.emptyList();
066        }
067    }
068}
